result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott L Stroik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 2 DAYS time served, with Huber.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail applies, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Provide DNA Sample.
No violent contact with victim, but no overnights or cohabitation, unless approved by court or agent.

Batterers Intervention program or individual therapy with BIP/DV focus.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott L Stroik in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
The victim is not in court but is requesting that the no contact order be modified to no violent contact.  Court grants that request.
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

ADDRESS INFO for Scott L Stroik
Current: 8751 Oak Park Dr #4, Oak Creek, WI 53154 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2015)
Prior: 1815 10th Avenue #2, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 DAYS time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 50 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program or individual therapy with BIP/DV focus.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim, but no overnights or cohabitation, unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, bail applies, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Scott L Stroik in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Victim NOT present in court, through ADA requested modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Scott L Stroik in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
At request of defense counsel due to scheduling conflict this case has been rescheduled from 5/21/2015 at 1:30 PM to Tuesday, 5/19/2015 at 1:30 PM before branch 23. ADA advised.

15RM023259  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/05/2015

15RM023257  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/05/2015
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription
No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer S.    AND/OR   her residence     AND/OR   her place of employment

Defendant Scott L Stroik in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-087

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/15 @ 1:30pm
